Code Writers' Workshop

Week 1: Sketching concepts and scoping projects

Introductions. Software?

  • Maciej Cegłowski, Web Design: The First 100 Years

Week 2: Selecting tools and coding prototypes

Colonialism & the web in general.

  • Ivan Illich, Silence is a Commons
  • Nabil Hassein, Against Black Inclusion in Facial Recognition
  • Nabil Hassein, Computing, climate change, and all our relationships
  • Ramsey Nasser, Unplain Text

Week 3: Developing projects and reconsidering decisions

Do users exist? Should things be interactive?

  • Pirijan Keth, Why Software is Slow and Shitty
  • Silvio Lorusso, The User Condition
  • Gabe Ferreira, A Proposal For Immersive Video

Week 4: Building out projects

Material, aesthetics & genre.

  • Olia Lialina, Vernacular Web Part 1, Part 2, Part 3
  • New strategies—Printmaking as a spatial process, as a transmissional process, and as a spatial-transmissional process
  • Stop trying to make the web look 'beautiful' – I've forgotten it already
  • Laurel Schwulst, My website is a shifting house next to a river of knowledge. What could yours be?
  • Our Aesthetic Categories: An Interview With Sianne Ngai

Week 5: Polish

Art? Online?

  • McKenzie Wark, Digital Provenance and the Artwork as Derivative
  • McKenzie Wark, My Collectible Ass
  • Alex Schwartz & Ziba Scott, 1,500 Slot Machines Walk into a Bar: Adventures in Quantity Over Quality
  • ‍Rahel Aima, Cloudy with a Chance of Bias
